definitions.definition: To place into isolation to prevent the spread of any contagious disease .
examples: Venice began quarantining incoming ships for 40 days in 1448 to prevent further outbreaks of bubonic plague .

definitions.definition: To enter or stay in quarantine , particularly to self-quarantine to avoid an epidemic disease .
examples: International travelers must quarantine themselves at their own expense in a designated hotel for 14 days upon arrival.

definitions.definition: To impose a quarantine , to establish quarantine regulations .

examples: J.F.K. " quarantined " Cuba rather than blockading it to avoid needless escalation of the conflict.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To place into isolation to prevent the spread of any contagious disease .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To enter or stay in quarantine , particularly to self-quarantine to avoid an epidemic disease .
( intransitive , obsolete ) To impose a quarantine , to establish quarantine regulations .
( figurative , transitive ) Synonym of isolate more generally .
